TextView.android:text:
Recipe Reader is an Android application for finding, viewing, and voice navigating recipes.
The app has 2 main parts or views. The 'Home' or 'Search' view and the 'Recipe' view.
The 'Home' view is the first view users see when the app opens. This view has 4 tabs; the main keyword search, advanced search, favorites, and settings. -The main keyword search allows users to search our database of recipes by keywords and displays results. -The advanced search shows categories and allows users to choose what kind of food they are looking to make and displays results accordingly. -The favorites tab shows the favorite recipes of the user currently logged in. -The settings tab allows users to log in or out of their account.
Search results in the 'Home' or 'Search' view are displayed as a list. Each item is shown with a picture for it's category, a favorite star, the name of the recipe, and the recipe's rating. -Clicking on the favorite start will add or remove the recipe from the current user's favorites list. -Clicking on the name of the recipe will open that recipe in the 'Recipe' view.
The 'Recipe' view shows the details of a recipe and allows the user to follow the recipe directions using their voice. The first screen the user sees when they open a recipe in the 'Recipe' view shows a picture of the recipe and some overview information. At the bottom on the screen there are 3 buttons. Start, Ingredients, and Instructions. -The Ingredients and Instructions buttons show the corresponding information without voice control. This is useful for browsing recipes or while shopping for supplies. -The Start button initiates the voice control feature. -All the instructions will be shown in a list. -The current step will always be highlighted. -The first step will be read to the user. -The user can user the 3 buttons at the top to navigate the recipe. (forward, backward, or repeat) -The user can also make a noise louder than the 'threshold' (see below under settings button) and a voice analyzer will appear. -the user can say any of these supported voice commands: -forward -back -repeat
Android Buttons: -The 'Back' button is used to move backward in the app. Such as: in the 'Recipe' view the back button can be used to return to search results. -The 'Settings' button has 2 different uses depending on the current view. -'Home' view: Shows these directions -'Recipe' view: Allows the user to set the 'threshold' for noise that activates the voice input.
For install help, more directions, and recipe uploading please visit our website @ http://cubist.cs.washington.edu/projects/12wi/cse403/r/index.html
